Introduction

Cascading Style Sheets(CSS) tell the browser how to display the text and other content that you write in HTML.

Note that CSS is case-sensitive so be careful with your capitalization.

  • Variables
    • CSS

    There are three main ways to apply CSS tyling.

    You can apply inline styles directly to HTML elements with the Style attribute. Alternatively you can place CSS rules within Style tags in an HTML document.

  • Functions
    • Change the color of Text

    Now let's see the color of some our text. We can do this by changing the Style of your h2 element.

    The property that is responsible for the color of an element's text is the color style property.

  • Style
    • Use CSS selectors to style Elements

    With CSS, there are hundreds of CSS properties that you can use to change the way an element looks on your page.

    Note that its important to have both opening and closing curly braces around each element's style rule(s).

  • Change The font-size of an element

    Font size is controlled by the font-size CSS property.

    Inside the same Style tag that contains your red-text class, create an entry for P elements and set the font-size to 16 pixels.
